Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration (fired red) consisting of part of sphinx standing or walking to left (part of wing, body with added red patch, row of dots on underbelly and upper part of advanced right hind leg); part of elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the sphinx, see Lemos 1991, pl. 78, no. 611.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 258, no. 485)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0502) (phase 2)
